env.description: Determines what type of network the connector is a part of. Can be: 'production', 'test'. Default: 'test'

minExpirationWindow.description: Minimum time the connector wants to budget for getting a message to the accounts its trading on. In milliseconds.

maxHoldWindow.description: Maximum duration (in milliseconds) the connector is willing to place funds on hold while waiting for the outcome of a transaction.

httpServerPort.description: Which port the http server for incoming ilp over http requests should listen on. Default: 8843

httpServerPath.description: Path to receive incoming ilp-over-http requests. Default: /ilp

adminApiPort.description: Which port the admin API should listen on. Default: 7780

adminApiHost.description: Host for the admin api to bind to. Warning: The admin API interface is public by default: '0.0.0.0'

adminApiAuth.description: Boolean to determine whether the admin api endpoints should use authentication.

authProviderUrl.description: Url for the remote authentication provider where you exchange an auth token for a peerId.

uplinkUrl.description: Url of the parent ilp endpoint.

assetCode.description: Currency code or other asset identifier for the "open" peer. Default: XRP

assetScale.description: Interledger amounts are integers, but most currencies are typically represented as fractional units, e.g. cents. This property defines how many Interledger units make up one regular units. For dollars, this would usually be set to 9, so that Interledger amounts are expressed in nanodollars. Default: 9
